Package gui

Class Player

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
gui.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChessPlayer, DiceChessPlayer
public abstract class Player extends MouseAdapter
Defines the basic structure any (human) player should have.

  • Method Details

    • deselect

      protected void deselect(IHighlighter highlighter)
      Performs a deselection; Clears the last selected square and any highlights (such as destination highlighting) that have been made.
      Parameters:
      highlighter - The highlighter that is responsible for highlighting chessboard squares on the chessboard that the player is capable of interacting with.

    • loadLegalMoves

      protected abstract void loadLegalMoves()
      When overridden, gets the legal moves the player has according the context the player is playing in. Meaning, for a normal chess game, this method will get the all legal moves the player has during his or her turn, while for a 'dice chess' game, this method will return the legal moves that the player is allowed to make according to the results of the dice roll.

    • play

      protected void play(IChessboardSquare selectedSquare)
      Attempts to play the owner of the last selected square to the currently selected square. If it is a valid move (meaning there is indeed a chess piece at the last selected square and the currently selected square is a possible destination that this chess piece can move to), then this move will be played.

    • playIn

      public void playIn(int team, IChessMatch match)

    • onPlay

      protected abstract void onPlay()
      When overridden, clears the variables that should be cleared only when a play has been made.

    • onSelect

      protected void onSelect(IChessboardSquare selectedSquare, IHighlighter highlighter)
      Confirms the selected chessboard square through performing a few operations such as whether a chess piece is located on the selected square and whether this chess piece has any room to perform moves etc.
      Parameters:
      selectedSquare - The square that just has been clicked.
      highlighter - The highlighter that is responsible for displaying the eye candy on the window that has been interacted with.
